{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3414844,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T16:14:15.791Z","cooked":"

Does the image for photonvision work on the Orange Pi 5 Pro. I see it works for the Orange Pi 5 and the Orange Pi 5 Plus, but didn’t see one for the Pro or don’t know if the other work for it.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T16:14:15.791Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":417,"reads":415,"readers_count":414,"score":2177.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3414957,"name":"Chris Graham","username":"PM_ME_ROBOThS","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/d6d6ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T19:38:32.663Z","cooked":"

They are currently working on it.
I’ve been talking with the dev team, and they’ve released a package that I’ve had loaded on mine and is working as expected so far.

GitHub

Release Dev · PhotonVision/photon-image-modifier

Latest dev release

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T19:38:32.663Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":393,"readers_count":392,"score":113.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"Chris Graham","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/PhotonVision/photon-image-modifier/releases/tag/Dev","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Release Dev · PhotonVision/photon-image-modifier · GitHub","clicks":62}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65826,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414963,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T19:56:32.840Z","cooked":"

Thank you. I found a recent one for the 5 pro on their latest dev releases as well.

It works too. Is there a 99.99% guarantee this wil be ready for next season as a full release so we can make some purchasing decisions.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T19:56:32.840Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":356,"readers_count":355,"score":106.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":65826,"username":"PM_ME_ROBOThS","name":"Chris Graham","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/d6d6ee/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414969,"name":"Chris Graham","username":"PM_ME_ROBOThS","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/d6d6ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T20:14:47.784Z","cooked":"

We are only guaranteed two things: death and taxes.

I took the gamble because even if worse comes to worse, I knew I could install ubuntu server on the OPi5Pro and still load the PV app on there; it just wouldn’t be as clean as what the PV team could produce.

If you already have the OPi5Pro, I’d load the dev release and have a backup plan in place, just in case. But I imagine they will have a prod release for next season.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T20:14:47.784Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":325,"readers_count":324,"score":64.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"Chris Graham","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":48345,"username":"narmstro","name":"Nicholas Armstrong","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65826,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415106,"name":"Craig Schardt","username":"crschardt","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/58956e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-13T03:26:32.358Z","cooked":"

I’ve been working on the OPi images and have ones for the 5Pro and the 5B in testing. I don’t see why they wouldn’t be part of the 2025 release. I only have a regular OPi5 though, so I’m not able to test these other coprocessors. You can help by testing during the off season and reporting problems, preferably as GitHub issues, to the developers.

Would you mind sharing why you’re thinking about buying the 5Pro rather than a standard 5? From what I can tell, the 5Pro doesn’t have any features that make it better than a 5 for running PhotonVision.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-13T03:26:32.358Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":285,"readers_count":284,"score":102.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"Craig Schardt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55459,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/5","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415139,"name":"Nicholas Armstrong","username":"narmstro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-13T10:41:07.550Z","cooked":"

I can. so I bought the pro not knowing the image had to be specific to whether it was a 5 or 5 pro. I understand that’s my fault and probably should’ve looked more at the specifics.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-13T10:41:07.550Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":256,"readers_count":255,"score":56.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"Nicholas Armstrong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55459,"username":"crschardt","name":"Craig Schardt","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/58956e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48345,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415147,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-13T12:41:25.822Z","cooked":"

How much “better” is the 5 pro vs the 5? At quick inspections it’s the same microprocessor and I don’t get the sense that photonvision is constrained by memory speed.

A quick google search only shows comparisons to the raspberry pi 5, and I’m interested in this communities take.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-13T13:00:37.892Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":73.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/7","custom_user_title":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415183,"name":"Craig Schardt","username":"crschardt","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/58956e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-13T14:43:53.814Z","cooked":"

I can totally understand why this is confusing. The company has chosen an incongruous naming scheme (5, 5B, 5Plus, and 5Pro) that provides no guidance about the differences between these boards. The availability can also be a problem forcing teams to buy try to pick the best substitute when their preferred option is out of stock.

Fortunately, from the perspective of running PhotonVision in FRC, the differences between the OrangePi 5 models aren’t significant. They all have the same CPU cores, speed, and NPU and that’s all that PhotonVision needs. PhotonVision uses very little memory (< 1 GB) so there is no need to get a board with more than 4GB.

The most important thing that teams often overlook is the need for a good quality power supply capable of providing 4A and having a low drop out voltage. Buying anything from Amazon is a gamble. My team uses one the D30V30F5 from Pololu with good results.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-13T14:43:53.814Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":239,"readers_count":238,"score":147.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"Craig Schardt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.pololu.com/product/4892","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pololu - 5V, 3.4A Step-Down Voltage Regulator D30V30F5","clicks":38}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":48345,"username":"narmstro","name":"Nicholas Armstrong","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55459,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/8","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415194,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-13T15:20:47.623Z","cooked":"

Your assessment is similar to mine. I didn’t see anything in the pro that would help out with the FRC/Photonvision use case. (Smaller never hurts of course)

Agree on the power supply. I’ve considered putting a capacitor in there but we’ve been lucky to not have a power interruption on the orange PI.

We’re currently using this one, as it was suggested by a friends who’s a very good coach and did a lot of part vetting. I like the heat sync.

amazon.com

Amazon.com: 10A 50W DC-DC 12V 24V to 5V converter buck regulator waterproof...

Buy 10A 50W DC-DC 12V 24V to 5V converter buck regulator waterproof power supply voltage transformer module: Power Converters - Amazon.com ✓ FREE DELIVERY possible on eligible purchases

I’ve got a few of the Pololu devices around somewhere.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-13T15:21:05.926Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":231,"readers_count":230,"score":66.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/YIPIN-HEXHA-Converter-Regulator-Transformer/dp/B095J3JF6J","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com","clicks":24}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55459,"username":"crschardt","name":"Craig Schardt","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/58956e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/9","custom_user_title":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415206,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-13T15:41:09.208Z","cooked":"
LPryor:

capacitor

The small caps for motor filtering are allowed and our RI has never had a problem with the cap needed for a LIDAR Lite at the end of a “long” power cable. I’ve seen caps that were too large ordered to be removed by the RI.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-08-13T15:41:09.208Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":51.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469763,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415208,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-13T15:47:41.033Z","cooked":"
SLAB-Mr.Thomas:

I’ve seen caps that were too large ordered to be removed by the RI.

What’s the small to large range you’ve seen in use or asked to be removed by a RI?

[ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-on-orange-pi-5-pro/469763/11","custom_user_title":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3415210,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-13T15:55:20.525Z","cooked":"

Lidar lite v2 needs a electrolytic capacitor 680uF if the power supply isn’t up to the task. Sorry I don’t know the one that was removed but it looked very large; I guess it would be classified as a capacitor power bank that brought attention to itself by its physical size.

How are you mounting the small capacitors to be capable of withstanding robot forces? We haven’t use capacitors and may not need them but I would like to add them to my arsenal.

Usually we mounted the capacitor and Molex connector for the power and I2C circuits on a small piece of plain perf board (no copper traces) at the end of the cables and soldered the wiring.

That makes sense - 680uF isn’t crazy large but large enough to help make a difference in this application. I was wondering if the “large” side reaches into super cap territory and it seems it gets there most likely.

I built a capacitive discharge battery tab welder with something on the order of 70,000uF+ at about 20V and that’s a pretty serious amount of energy; discharging that is a mean fat spark for sure. Way too much for FRC use - it would probably flat out power a device like the Lidar unit for numerous seconds on power cut.

To actually answer your question.

This COULD be an issue but it depends how much you trust that 10V spec. I don’t trust it at all haha.

Generic regulators built like the linked one and for cheap generalize many of their specifications and don’t actually test their own product to ensure they can meet the listed number. The business model is to make and market something that is minimally viable and sells, refunding the small% of folks unhappy with performance or warranty issue.

So it’s a “Your Milage May Vary” situation. Ones you buy may work this year, and the same ones purchased from the same supplier may not work the same due to an invisible product revision and actual performance change next year.

It sounds like these “worked” for a few folks, but looking forward we have FRC related suppliers spinning up products (Zinc, MitoCANdria, etc…) that will be more reliable and consistent spec-wise.
